text: Paul Emordi (born 25 December 1965) is a retired Nigerian athlete who competed in the long jump and triple jump. His personal best in long jump was 8.25 metres, achieved in June 1987 in Baton Rouge. This ranks him third among Nigerian long jumpers, only behind Yusuf Alli (8.27 m) and Charlton Ehizuelen (8.26 indoor). ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1984 |African Championships |Rabat, Morocco |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Long jump |7.90 m |- |Olympic Games |Los Angeles, United States |21st |Triple jump |15.88 m |- |rowspan=2|1985 |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Cairo, Egypt |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Long jump |7.90 m |- |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Triple jump |16.56 m |- |rowspan=4|1987 |World Indoor Championships |Indianapolis, United States |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Long jump |8.01 m |- |World Student Games |Zagreb, FR Yugoslavia |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Long jump |8.11 m |- |All-Africa Games |Nairobi, Kenya |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Long jump |8.23 m |- |World Championships |Rome, Italy |16th |Long jump |7.80 m |} ==See also== * List of champions of Africa of athletics ==External links== * * sports-reference Category:1965 births Category:Living people Category:Nigerian male long jumpers Category:Nigerian male triple jumpers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Nigeria Category:African Games gold medalists for Nigeria Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1987 All-Africa Games Category:Universiade silver medalists for Nigeria Category:World Athletics Indoor Championships medalists Category:Medalists at the 1987 Summer Universiade
title: Paul Emordi
